div.p: A72/1217, unit 596, VPRS 3991/P inward registered correspondence VA 475 Chief Secretary's Department, Public Record Office, Victoria.

In reply to your letter,
See T. Ware to M, 5 February 1872. received last night, I have the honor to inform you, that I was requested by the honorable the President of the Board of Lands and Works to submit to (him also) a counter report to the Document of the Board of the botanic Garden, a copy of the Document being sent to me also by the Direction of the President.
I understood also indirectly from Mr. Grant, that the bot. Gardens Department was to be placed under his administration.
The honorable Gentleman having proceeded to Sydney, I was left under the impression, that my counter report would only be required after his return and thus I left it unfinished.

Being now requested, to forward my answers to the honorable the Chief Secretary, I shall hasten to finish the required document and forward it to Mr. Duffy in a few days.
M in fact submitted his response the same day; see M to C. Duffy, 6 February 1872.
